title: Graph of electric field of conducting shell

content.question: A conducting spherical shell of radius R has charge q uniformly distributed on its outer surface. The graph above represents electric field strength E versus distance r from the center of the spherical shell. Which of the following graphs best represents E versus r when the charge on the spherical shell is doubled to 2q ?

choices.label: Choice A starts at the origin and is horizontal along the x-axis until uppercase R. To the right of uppercase R, the curve is concave up and decreasing, starting at the height of third y-axis tick mark and having an asymptote at the x-axis.

Choice B starts at the third tick mark on the y-axis and is horizontal until uppercase R. To the right of uppercase R, the curve is concave up and decreasing, starting at the height of third y-axis tick mark and having an asymptote at the x-axis.

Choice C starts at the third tick mark on the y-axis and is horizontal until uppercase R. To the right of uppercase R, the curve is concave up and decreasing, starting at the height of sixth y-axis tick mark and having an asymptote at the x-axis.

Choice D starts at the origin and is horizontal until uppercase R. To the right of uppercase R, the curve is concave up and decreasing, starting at the height of sixth y-axis tick mark and having an asymptote at the x-axis.

Choice E starts at the sixth tick mark on the y-axis and is horizontal until uppercase R. To the right of uppercase R, the curve is concave up and decreasing, starting at the height of sixth y-axis tick mark and having an asymptote at the x-axis.

content.answer: Choice D starts at the origin and is horizontal until uppercase R. To the right of uppercase R, the curve is concave up and decreasing, starting at the height of sixth y-axis tick mark and having an asymptote at the x-axis.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
